text: Within my group I have four main pillars.
First pillar being business applications,

which is responsible for
all our corporate applications.

And then the second
pillar is cybersecurity.
The third pillar is analytics,

where we do everything
being data driven for the company.

And last but not least is
the pillar for cloud operations
and the global infrastructure.

We decided to
migrate all our data center

into AWS stack, including
our Oracle E-business Suite.

We started this journey of
migration earlier this year

and sometime in January
with a deadline that we need

to migrate all our 160
applications with close

to 400 terabyte of data
by end of September.

And we were very fortunate
to be able to achieve
that within eight months.

And with all the things that
AWS has been delivering,

or the innovation or the
reinventing aspect of it,

with the various services,
that made NETGEAR business

expand pretty fast. There
are many benefits that

the team or the company
organization achieved
out of this, right?
The first being is the synergy

of having everything
running into a platform.
The second big benefit is cost, right?
So being able to leverage AWS services,
the platform ecosystem,

and we have been able to
save licensing aspect to it.

Those were, I would say, the
key factors in terms of
centralizing everything

and adding to it
a security aspect of it.

Running an ecosystem
into a cloud platform,

which has embedded security
into it, made it easier

for NETGEAR to be able to
launch those more securely.

Cost, security, disaster
recovery, high availability.

Those were the key benefits
that NETGEAR was able
to get benefit out of this migration.

So now any innovation, anything
that we would like to do,
it made it simpler and easier for us.
